title: Space Pirate Password Breach
description: Analyze intercepted space pirate credentials to identify security vulnerabilities and discover their infiltration strategy.
xisMessage: Navigator! We've intercepted a data dump from the space pirates who attacked our ship. The file contains crew passwords from a compromised outpost. We need to analyze their security practices and find the master access code they're using to infiltrate other systems!

missionBrief.title: URGENT SECURITY BREACH ANALYSIS
missionBrief.content:
The space pirates have compromised the Kepler Station outpost and stolen crew credentials. Your mission:

‚Ä¢ Analyze the intercepted password database
‚Ä¢ Identify security vulnerabilities in their password policies
‚Ä¢ Find patterns that reveal the pirates' master access strategy
‚Ä¢ Extract the flag that proves you've uncovered their method
missionBrief.briefingText: Intelligence Report: Space pirates breached Kepler Station using a coordinated attack. We've recovered their data dump containing crew_passwords.txt.

objectives.description: Download and examine the intercepted password file
Identify the 3 most common weak password patterns
Find the admin account with the weakest password
Discover the hidden master access code pattern
Submit the flag in format: NAVIGATOR{...}

evidenceFiles.description: Intercepted password database from Kepler Station

progressiveHints.title: üîç Start Your Investigation
progressiveHints.content: Begin by examining the intercepted password file. Use the cat crew_passwords.txt command to display its contents. Look at the structure - what information is provided for each crew member?
progressiveHints.learningGoal: Understanding data structure and file examination

progressiveHints.title: üéØ Identify Weak Patterns
progressiveHints.content: Many passwords follow common weak patterns. Look for passwords that are: dictionary words, simple sequences (123456), keyboard patterns (qwerty), or common defaults (password, admin). Try using grep to search for specific patterns.

progressiveHints.title: üëë Focus on Admin Accounts
progressiveHints.content: Administrative accounts are prime targets! Look for users with roles like 'admin', 'administrator', or 'security'. These accounts often have the weakest passwords because they're created quickly. What patterns do you see in admin passwords?
progressiveHints.learningGoal: Targeting high-value accounts in security analysis

progressiveHints.title: üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è Find the Master Pattern
progressiveHints.content: Space pirates are clever! They've hidden their master access code in plain sight. Look carefully at ALL the passwords - one of them contains the flag in the format NAVIGATOR{...}. The flag itself reveals their infiltration strategy!
progressiveHints.learningGoal: Advanced pattern detection and flag discovery

progressiveHints.title: üí° Security Insights
progressiveHints.content: Congratulations! You've discovered that weak passwords are the primary attack vector. This challenge demonstrates how poor password policies create system-wide vulnerabilities that attackers can exploit for unauthorized access.

walkthrough.title: Complete Solution Walkthrough
walkthrough.description: Step-by-step guide to solving the password breach challenge

steps.title: Download Evidence
steps.explanation: This loads the intercepted password database into your terminal environment for analysis.
steps.learningNote: Real incident response starts with securing and cataloging evidence.

steps.title: Examine the Password File
steps.explanation: This shows the format: username:password:role:last_access. Notice how the data is structured and what information is available for analysis.
steps.expectedOutput: Full password database with crew credentials
steps.learningNote: Understanding data structure is crucial before beginning analysis.

steps.title: Search for Admin Accounts
steps.explanation: Administrative accounts are high-value targets. This command filters the data to show only accounts with admin-related roles.
steps.expectedOutput: List of admin accounts with their passwords
steps.learningNote: Attackers prioritize admin accounts for maximum system access.

steps.title: Find the Hidden Flag
steps.action: Search for the infiltration code pattern
steps.explanation: Space pirates have hidden their infiltration code in the password field. This search reveals their method.
steps.learningNote: Attackers often hide in plain sight using legitimate-looking accounts.

steps.title: Submit the Flag
steps.explanation: This flag reveals that weak passwords are the primary security vulnerability exploited in this breach.
steps.learningNote: Weak password policies create systemic vulnerabilities across entire organizations.

analysisResults.securityInsights: The infiltrated system shows classic signs of poor password policy enforcement. Administrative accounts use predictable patterns, making them prime targets for space pirate attacks. The breach demonstrates how weak passwords create systemic vulnerabilities.
recommendations: Deploy multi-factor authentication for admin accounts
